snippet: As lawmakers prepare to debate a strike on the Assad government, Syrians on both sides of the issue work to influence Congress and the American public.
abstract: Syrians and Syrian-Americans are taking to social media and bombarding offices of American lawmakers with their views as Congress prepares to debate strike on the Assad government; lobbying effort has built to crescendo as opposition stresses their fight for political rights in face of violence and Assad's supporters emphasize secularism of his government.
lead_paragraph: As lawmakers prepare to debate a strike on the Assad government, Syrians on both sides of the issue work to influence Congress and the American public.

headline.main: On Both Sides, Syrians Make Pleas to U.S.
headline.print_headline: On Both Sides, Syrians Make Pleas to U.S.
